com.nttdocomo.ui
Class ImageLabel

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.nttdocomo.ui.Component
        |
        +--com.nttdocomo.ui.ImageLabel
public final class ImageLabel
extends Component

This defines the component to display images. The image label class is one of the UI components used in high level API and a component for displaying stationary images. The image labels for which stationary images are not designated one filled with the background color.

When the component size is designated and is greater than the image size the image shall be centrally aligned. When the component size is smaller than the image size, the image is partially clipped and displayed from the upper left. The size of the displayed part of the image is the same as the component size.

When an instance of this class exists, an instance of the image class referred to by this instance should not be in a unusable state. This means that when an image object is retrieved from the MediaImage instance using the getImage method, the unuse method and dispose method shall be called after using the ImageLabel instance. 

       ...
       MediaImage img = MediaManager.getImage( ... );
       img.use();
       ImageLabel label = new ImageLabel(img.getImage());
       ...
       // label use ends
       img.unuse();
       img.dispose();
       ...
In addition, when the image held by the designated image class instance is invalid, the image is not drawn. The label is filled with the background color in this case.

See Also:
Label

Constructor Detail

ImageLabel

public ImageLabel()
This creates a label without designating the label image. When created, it is visible. To set visible or invisible, the setVisible method is used.

ImageLabel

public ImageLabel(Image image)
This creates the label after designating the label image. When created, it is visible. To set visible or invisible, the setVisible method is used.

Parameters:
image - Designates a label image
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - Generated when null is designated for the argument image.
UIException - Generated when a disposed image is designated for the argument image (ILLEGAL_STATE).
Method Detail
